website_summaries.verdict: A low-cost hanging lantern that is both unobtrusive and effective.
pros: Works outside with a 1/2 acre radius
Can be suspended from branch or ceiling
cons: Shorter range and shorter power cord than some competitors in its class

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all cost! Made a hero out of a junebug.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! This thing lasted about 5 minutes! One junebug took one for the team. Sacrificed himself for the greater good of bugs everywhere. He's a hero's hero among bug kind. I believe I heard the sound of taps being gently played afterward by a band of crickets. The only thing I can positively say about this product is that with the light on and no zapper ability the light attracted a million of the junebugs friends to mourn him during the funeral procession.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy I.

customer_reviews.title: Kills everything but Mosquitos.
customer_reviews.text: I saw a lot of great reviews on this zapper, and I was very excited to use it, but I tried it with and without the mosquito attractant, and they don't even notice it's there. On the other hand it's great redneck fun to watch it zap moths, but for mosquitos...nope. It could be the type of mosquitos we have in San Antonio are just not attracted to light.
customer_reviews.author: B Sop

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not..
customer_reviews.text: If you want to kill moths, get this. If you want to kill mosquitoes or gnats, maybe look at getting something else. I tried setting it up in three different places, doesn't help. Also tried turning it on at different times before I'm in the yard, and didn't notice any difference. I was so excited to be able to be outside, but this didn't work at all for me.
customer_reviews.author: As Honest As Possible

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: We researched this product in-depth. And we were convinced that based on what we found we would be satisfied with this product. Well to our surprised and disappointment, the product does not work. We live in Tampa Florida; we’ve tried it several times we placed it in different places and even used the chemical strip that you put on the bottom of the unit and it still fails. We would discourage others from buying this product. Not happy to waste our money, time, and hope.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one
customer_reviews.text: I bought my last Flowtron in 2013 and it worked well all these years. After 7 years of faithful service, it finally quit working. I just bought a second one and it works just like my last one. It does a great job killing mosquitoes. It does however kill some other fying insects as well. The only thing is you really need to change the octenol attractant every month or it will not work well. Great under $40 investment that lasted 7 years. Let's hope this new one last just as long.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Worked for one day only
customer_reviews.text: Worked for one day and then stopped working. I used to have the bigger model and it lasted 3 years so hopefully this was a fluke but i felt obligated to to let everyone know
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: ZZZZAAAAAPPPP
customer_reviews.text: This is a bug killing machine! There are nights when we here almost constant zapping from this thing. It makes me smile each time I hear it zap! That's one less insect to bother me. When the insect killer is on we can really tell the difference. A note of advice, mount the insect killer at least 50-100 feet from where you want to hang out in the yard. This thing attracts bugs so you don't want it near you. Ours makes a zapping noise just after plugging it in, which was scary the first time. Overall, it has been doing great work for us and allowing us to enjoy evenings in the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Fahillion Tech

customer_reviews.title: Socal mosquitos just laugh at this device
customer_reviews.text: I live in southern california and this does not work in getting rid of mosquitos even with the attractant. I initially set it up without the attractant away from the house and zero mosquito kills. Then tried it away again but with attractant and zero kills. Next I hung it right by my back screen door where there are 5-6 mosquitos at all times hanging on the screen. Wake up and there are a bunch otherbugs fried but maybe one mosquito. One kill per day doesn’t cut it for me. So why all the positive reviews? This device might work with some other kinds of mosquitos.
customer_reviews.author: Niche

customer_reviews.title: Real deal- no off-brand Chinese junk
customer_reviews.text: This is the good old, sturdy, well-made old-fashioned "FLOWTRON" that's been around for years. I LOVE this thing!! I actually got it for farm flies, they prefer the smell of meat or "doo-doo" (sorry) but it is way worth the buy. I also have a pond, & wanted to ensure mosquitoes got ZAPPED if they came around. The light bulb, everything worked when I got it- & I got it delivered 2 days sooner than Amazon predicted it would. Thanks- GREAT item, I love my zapper!!
customer_reviews.author: Analog

customer_reviews.title: seriously
customer_reviews.text: Works..quiet.. Generous SIX INCH POWER CORD ! really ?! Really.. Longer normal power cord would have been a five star.. 6" just messed with my head. wow just weird But it works... REALLY WELL I just bought a second..
customer_reviews.author: shoppers critique

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective on DC Mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: We live in DC and have been subjected to the HORDES of mosquitos that rule this dominion. I bought this zapper in hopes that it would put a dent into their populations, but it had virtually no impact. While we had it up, we would watch clouds (not exaggerating) of mosquitos outside our door waiting for us to open up, completely uninterested in the zapper. We even tried using the mosquito attractant that came with the zapper and even that was ineffective. Meanwhile it does kill other, non-nuisance bugs, which we don't want to kill. Bottom line is if you live in DC, this product won't make your mosquito-based misery any better.
customer_reviews.author: Brent E. Boy

customer_reviews.title: We enjoy our yard again!
customer_reviews.text: For under $40 this thing is great! I plugged this bug zapper in the moment it arrived. I have left it plugged in for the past week and have had to clean it about 5 times. It was so loaded with dead mosquitoes that the light was almost not visible! It takes a day or two to kill down the population around the yard. our yard is about a 1/2 acre and we have woods and a creek back there, so lots of bugs. We can finally sit and enjoy our lawn, watch the kids play without getting eaten alive or dousing ourselves in deet.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Couple improvements would be good
customer_reviews.text: All in all this is pretty decent. It would be much better if it had a longer power cord. The tiny one it has makes it difficult to set it up the way I wanted to. The other thing would be to have slightly bigger openings so bigger mosquitoes and other insects can get through. I've seen many just hovering around it in circles but couldn't go meet their fate. Better for them, not so much for me.
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Time & Money
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worthless if you want to get rid of dangerous pests like Mosquitoes! It even does a poor jog of just killing the assortment of insects typically attracted to lights at night. I gave this thing a try for several months then put it out in the trash, wso don't waste you money. I replaced the Flowtron with an Aspectek Bug Zapper, available on Amazon, and WOW!!!! what a difference! The next morning the Aspectek was covered in mosquitoes; take a look at the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonheart

customer_reviews.title: Bottom clip
customer_reviews.text: Hello my name is John Majka, I received the flow Tron outdoor product (bug zapper) last night, and it’s missing the bottom clip that holds the Octenol mosquito Attractant. if possible I do not wanna return the bug zapper just want to get the bottom clip. sent to me, please advise me thank you. My cell phone number is +18134463987
customer_reviews.author: John Majka

customer_reviews.title: kills bugs
customer_reviews.text: kills lots of bugs. Although seems not as powerful as the much older Flowtron brother I had to retire after what seemed decades of 24-7 use. The old one would fry a bug with a ccrrraaaacccckkkkkk sounding like a gun and there would be no bug parts left on the electrical grids. The new one goes ZZZiit frying the bug dry but leaving the hard skeletons of the bugs stuck suspended between the vertical electrodes until i tap the unit or blow the stubborn skeletons out with compressed air. All in all I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: This thing kills mostly moths.. my kids & I get about 25-30 mosquito bites in minutes from our yard. We have a small residential yard in town (it's only .17 acres!) and we keep it very clean. We live in Kansas. I don't know what to do about the mosquitoes. They are relentless :( they eat us alive. Wasted money again :(
customer_reviews.author: peppermint77

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. I returned it.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the zapper. It seemed very under-powered and clogged because the bugs didn't explode and burn off the grate. My old unit had more power, which would blow the bugs right off. This thing hardly even popped. I returned it for something different.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this thing for a couple of weeks and the only thing that I have noticed about it...it does not attract bugs! I have seen 2 bugs killed by the trap in the time that I have had it. Never heard it zap (not sure if it is like the old zappers or not), never saw any bugs anywhere near it. I cant say how easy it is to clean as it has not killed anything, it does not emit any noise that I can tell. I am not sure if I got a lemon or not, but it does not do what it is supposed to do. Wasted $40
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Makes a beautiful zap sound when killing annoying bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this bug zapper! I had purchased another brand at a local store and I was very disappointed in it's performance, I think some of the larger insects were using it to tickle each other. When I told my buddy about the lackluster performance I was getting out of the original one I purchased he recommended this brand saying he's had it for a while and it has worked great. I received this and plugged it in day 1 and have never been happier to hear that zap zap zap sound of bugs being fried! The only downside is that it is not easy to clean as you have to disassemble it completely to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Kleinsak

customer_reviews.title: I have only had this for a week and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for a week and it has already broke ... I had it hanging on a shepherds in my back yard at night and would bring it in during the day just so it wouldn't get damaged by wind or rain but somehow the plastic guard where the screw attaches near the top has already broke ... I was really looking forward to this taking care of the bugs in our yard but I guess I will have to order a different product ... It's definitely not durable at all for it to break within a week and only used it three nights while we sat on our back patio ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these in Sep 2019. Just lost both units over the last two days. Bulbs went out on both. At $23plus/bulb, not sure I will be using these anymore. The zapper definitely killed bugs and we are especially happy it got those little gold flies. I did not use the mosquito attractant so killing mosquitoes was not as effective. I was hoping the bulbs would last a lot longer and I wouldn't have to buy replacement items. With both bulbs gone in less than a year; I am not sure I can recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: MutLovrar

customer_reviews.title: Don't understand the good reviews
customer_reviews.text: I few negative things that prompted my rating: 1) Very cheap plastic pocket for the cartridge, which is supposed to be changed every 30 days. I'm sure it will not last long before breaking; 2) We placed it outside less than 15ft away from our outside siting area, and we still got bitten by mosquitoes. I was hearing some bugs being zapped, but were they mosquitoes or bigger bugs? 3) It has a very loud buzzing/crackling sound when bugs get into the light. It's to the point of being annoying; 4) The light cord is in the range of 12" long. So short that it's impossible to install anywhere without pulling an extension cord to it.
customer_reviews.author: tk

customer_reviews.title: "Zap" when turning it on startled me. Works well. Not sure about mosquitoes, though.
customer_reviews.text: Flowtron BK-15D. Haha, first time I plugged it in the "zap" startled me. It does make a noise when it gets a bug but that doesn't bother me. I am pleased with how it works. Yes, plastic is a bit cheap, but I expected that for the price I paid. It is sturdy enough. There are not a lot of bugs where I live but I want to cut the moth population down and kill any mosquitoes. I am not sure how well the attractant works, but I have not been getting bitten by mosquitoes this season when I am outside in the evenings.
customer_reviews.author: LLL

customer_reviews.title: This product not only contains Mercury, Which causes cancer but it’s not returnable.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because we have a serious problem with mosquitoes. What they don’t tell you in the description of this product, is that it’s made with Mercury!!!!!!!! I tried to return it and it was not accepted due to dangerous and flammable Reasons. But they can sell it to you fast enough. How convenient. Save your money look into other ones. Not a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me.
customer_reviews.text: We have a 1/2 acre next to a lake but don’t want to attract the entire bug population. We got the 15 just to zap a small portion of flys and mosquitoes that annoy us on the patio. It works great, and if you leave it on all night there are hundreds of dead bugs on and below it piled up.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Carr

customer_reviews.title: Bug vaporizer!!
customer_reviews.text: So far, it’s great! This thing, literally, vaporizes the bugs! Keep it away from the door & where you’re sitting because, obviously, it attracts the bugs to it. Cord is very short & our outlet is right by the door so, I hung the zapper from a shepherd’s hook & ran the extension cord to the outlet. I used cable stables to attach extension cord to the house to keep it away from rain. We’ll see how long it lasts but...so far, so good!!
customer_reviews.author: Threeez

customer_reviews.title: Insect KILLER!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cheaper zapper along with a more expensive Dynotrap unit to help with mosquito in my back yard. This zapper may not be as humane as the Dynotrap, but it is 100x more effective...in killing every flying insects. It draws and killed so much flying bugs that I had to turn it off when we are not using the back yard. The thing was zapping all night that there were thousands dead and injured bugs covered the ground underneath. I can't tell if there were mosquitoes among the carnage because it cooks smaller bugs to a crispy smoky ashes. Meanwhile, the Dynotrap managed to trap in maybe 20 insects, none of which are mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: JonathanV

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bug Killer
customer_reviews.text: We bought various other brands in the $65 to $80 range, none come close to this BK 15D 1/2 acre coverage. We live on a ranch in the desert, it handles flies, mosquitos very well. My husband said it beats all the rest in extremely easy cleanability and its high intensity UV light. We had bought another brand, but it was difficult to clean and needed cleaning every 3 days and its UV light capacity was very poor. We bought a 2nd Flowtron!
customer_reviews.author: Joy Graves

customer_reviews.title: No complaints, it works
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with this item, no frills, but it works as stated. It is very compact, and it definitely lures bugs in to a fiery death. Perfect as our land backs up to FL swampland, we've got an amazing tropical yard, but we get bled dry from all the mosquitos, so it leaves us stuck inside the lanai, but this seems to be helping to control some of the bugs. As soon as my dusk till dawn timer turns on the zapper, you hear it begin frying the bugs every second or two.
customer_reviews.author: Nyoka

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed efficient zapper
customer_reviews.text: This is a reasonably priced bug zapper that works quite well for outdoor use. Hung it on a Shepard's hook under the back overhang of the house which keeps it dry from the elements. Zapped a pile of bugs the first night. Next few days not so many but the weather had something to do with that. Warm, humid days and the bugs were out and getting fried. Nothings quite so satisfying than the sound of the zapper sizzling a pesky fly or mosquito and any other flying pest. Was attacked by tiger mosquitoes in the garden a few weeks back. They were zapping me right and left. Now it's my turn.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great for bugs
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a bug zapper and after reading a lot of reviews this one was perfect for what I needed it for. Fairly quite operation until you hear it zap a bug which is fine. I clean it once a week by simply blowing the dead bugs off. It is very safe to use and UL listed. I keep mine on 24/7 and the bugs have dropped significantly. Mosquitoes tend to buzz around the light but not close enough to get zapped. As far as electricity usage is concerned, it isn’t even noticeable on my electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: jon Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Electric chair for flies! when their wings get tired 🤣
customer_reviews.text: I HATE FLIES!!! Provides a good light show at night! Especially when one gets stuck in just the right spot between the rails for a 5-6 second SIZZLER lol. This thing kills a ton of flies, all you gotta do is hang it, plug it in and the zapper automatically declares jihad to all those infidel flies lol did I mention that I hate flies 🤬🤢🤮 Left it plugged in by accident on two separate rainy nights and no issues at all just kept on zapping away like a champ Rocky Balboa style, takes a beating and won't quit.
customer_reviews.author: Chato

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: With summer here we were desperate to get this Insect killer. We get so many bugs in our yard it’s not that enjoyable to sit outside. I was so excited to receive this product, however we have been using it for the past two weeks and it doesn’t work at all! It’s been a waste of money 😏. I now have to look into a different brand. Our yard is about 20 x 25 sqf not even that big!
customer_reviews.author: Jen Man

customer_reviews.title: Zip Zip Zap!
customer_reviews.text: It was a warm summers night. The air was still. We were enjoying our late night food when all of a sudden. from around the corner! A humongous crane fly makes its way towards us. But then, this wonderful product worked its magic. The attention of the beast has diverted towards the glowing blue light. ZIP ZIP ZAP! The beast was out like a light. Bye Bye Bugs. Hello amazing beast tamer.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Estanislao

customer_reviews.title: Great job but won’t hang straight...kills a lot of bugs.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is well built so not sure why the excessively short cord. No matter what I did I could not get it to hang straight. Trust me when I say short of just plugging it in and letting the extension cord (you will need one) hang loose the zapper won’t hang straight...it will from one angle but not the other. Anyway, as for how it works...very well and quiet until you hear the “Zap” and know it’s doing it job. I would buy another but I would also suggest the manufacturer extends the cord by at least another 12 inches...I’d pay a little more for that alone.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Requires replacement cartridges
customer_reviews.text: It worked GREAT for the FIRST DAY ONLY. I was so happy to hear the ZAP as it annihilated the pests! But the next night, NO ZAP! Then I read it required extra attractant matts. Supposedly, one matt was effective for quite a while, but I thought maybe it ran out faster because of our hotter than usual temperatures. I was surprised at the price of the replacement matts. Nearly cost-prohibitive, but I ordered them anyway. The new cartridges don't seem to be effective. I haven't heard any more zaps. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: REBECCA FERNANDO

customer_reviews.title: Worthless for Us -- But Maybe You'll Have Good Results?
customer_reviews.text: Bought the lamp hoping it was going to help with mosquitos on our back porch. I live in Arizona where there aren't too many flying bugs, but mosquitos breed in small damp areas of our neighbors planters -- caused by moisture drip lines running from their air conditioners. Installed the lamp and bait as per the directions. Tried it for over a month. Killed more moths than mosquitos, which is not saying much. I'm glad other customers are having luck with this unit -- as I think its pretty worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Non PC

customer_reviews.title: Lots of zapping power. Nice with attractant use.
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome in conjunction with good attractant. A couple mosquito attractants are included and work awesome for a short duration. You can always buy more like I did in order for it to be most effective. Without the attractant it will only kill moths. Use with caution as the attractant I had at the bottom was off center. I tried to move it over and got zapped. About the same power as a horse electric fence IMO. Surprisingly powerful just for bugs. Is quite loud when you get a big moth or big bug in it. As long as you use an attractant it’s very effective on mosquitos. Don’t expect much if you don’t use an attractant.
customer_reviews.author: Studio-Steve

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job Nicely - Recommended
customer_reviews.text: My older outdoor bug zapper finally stopped working after 3 years of continuous use, so time to buy new. The Flowtron design and price was just what I was looking for. I have it mounted in my back patio, suspended from a ceiling rafter about 6-feet up. It works great, zapping the outdoor flying bug population efficiently and effectively. It really helps cutting down the mosquito population. There are a number of similar designs on the market, which I am sure work fine, but this specific product is worth your consideration. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: 10th Legion

customer_reviews.title: it really works
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my mother who has a small patio enclosed by a vinyl fence that backs up to woods with a bit of a water drainage problem. This is in the southeast where mosquitos run in packs. We installed the zapper on the outside of her fence so the little critters gravitate away from her patio and house to the other side of the fence and get nailed. She absolutely swears by this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noticed improvement!
customer_reviews.text: We have a big yard so we really don’t hear it so much where we have it all n our shed. It does the job. You have to check it every so often it will be covered with mosquitoes and bug...they love it! We use an old tooth brush with the bristles cut down a bit to get through the slats to clean it. That is probably my biggest complaint it’s tricky trying to clean it. If they could improve that I could give a higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: MPM

customer_reviews.title: Moths on fire!
customer_reviews.text: If you are interested in what insects engulfed in balls of fire look like, this is your product. Mosquitos and gnats meet their end with a little “zap”, but moths... oh boy... you are in for a treat! UPDATE: After 3 weeks my bug zapper stopped zapping bugs and started to smell like an electrical fire. I returned it for a replacement. The 2nd unit is working well for 2 weeks. Time will tell if there is a quality problem. I subtracted 1 star from my review for this.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron O

customer_reviews.title: Holy smokes! Literally!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a bug zapping machine!!! I read another review where another user had cut the plastic grate every 3rd bar to allow larger bugs access in, so I did the same. This thing works like a charm. Be sure you hang it 15-20 ft. from your sitting area or any BBQ grills, etc. - this thing zaps bugs to a crisp (sends them up in smoke, literally!) & sends them flying!
customer_reviews.author: Erica M.

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before purchasing this product and unfortunately, like so many other reviews, it fell into the 1 star category as I could not give it any less of a star. Upon receiving the item, I opened the box and noticed the device itself was securely packaged (the plastic part of the zapper.) I plugged it in and I heard a buzz and then no power. Thought maybe the bulb was blown or maybe knocked around during transit. I have returned the item. They really need to figure out a safer way to transport/deliver an item that has a simple pop in and pop out bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Trishia Hyden

customer_reviews.title: Works... but at a price.
customer_reviews.text: The cord is too short... maybe 6 inches only! It needs to be much longer 6-8 feet so it can be hung on a pole and plugged into an outlet. As of now I had to purchase an outside extension cord and attach it to the bug zapper and tape the connection to make it waterproof for outside use. Then run the extension cord to the outside outlet. Very inconvenient. Doesn’t do well when it rains I have to unplug it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Allows My Citrus to Grow Unmolested by Leaf Miners
customer_reviews.text: I am hanging this by my citrus tree which was heavily attacked by leaf miners. I tried everything except for toxic pesticides to keep the moths and other insects causing the leaf miners disease, and nothing worked. After hanging this next to the tree, I see a lot of dead moths and other insects each morning and the tree is recovering very nicely. Who knew there's another use for this product? It is well-made, easy enough to clean and the "noise" is music to my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Cecille Chan

customer_reviews.title: Quality control!!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for little over 3 months and it stopped working. I purchased the bulb, thinking that the bulb was out. Turns out the small bulb inside the unit was burned out. I don't know where to purchase this bulb and I do not see the contact information of the seller. Can't buy the whole thing because of the burned out fuse. Does anyone know where to order this small bulb? P.S. the wire on the bulb was not wrapped property with a waterproof tape. That's what made the bulb to burn out.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Chon

customer_reviews.title: no good, please read
customer_reviews.text: Kills maybe 5% of the bugs. Moths melt to it and it doesn't attract flies or mosquitos even with the bait. The progs are too large for the smaller bugs. Waste of $50. It also catches the bugs on fire, so be careful whats below. We had to move things to make sure we didn't have a house fire at night.
customer_reviews.author: m kost

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great
customer_reviews.text: I've had it in my carport for 3 weeks so far to combat the horrifying onslaught of mosquitos that plagues our new house. We have seen a massive reduction in the amount of bugs that end up in the house. It kills everything that comes up to it - flies, praying mantises, mosquitos, beetles - and does so with a tremendous ZAP. My carport is littered with dead bug carcasses, so many in fact that once a week I get my leaf blower and blow all the bodies away out to the lawn. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.text: It’s so nice to hear the zapping of the little flying critters even though the sound still makes us jump! This thing attracts all sorts of bugs, and unfortunately some of the good ones, too. Like lady bugs and a few butterflies have fallen victim to the zapper. We haven’t really noticed any mosquitos in the zapper, so I’m not sure how accurate the advertising is. It definitely attracts bugs all day and night, but the mosquitos in Texas must be too smart for this zapper because we have it by our patio and we still get chewed up like crazy by the mosquitos. All in all though, it does it’s job with other bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Zwieryznski

customer_reviews.title: Not Fly
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews and seeing pictures of bugs layered on the light, I thought I had found the solution to our overwhelming fly problem (courtesy of our dogs) I followed the directions to a T. This thing didn't attract ONE fly. I swear, I could hear high pitched giggling as the flies passed by it and maybe a "Not gonna happen" from a fly or two. Back to the drawing board. Maybe a nasty fly strip will do better for us. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this is frustration from sitting outside and being attacked by mosquitos and flies. I read a great Detailed review that convinced me to get it. It works great and does what it’s supposed to. The only downside is the cord is super short. As you can see in my photo and video, I have to use a chair to be able to use it because the cord is so short it can’t even reach the floor. That being said, you’ll have to get an extension cord. It’s not too loud until of course a bug gets zapped. Great zapper but would’ve rated higher if the cord was a normal long length.
customer_reviews.author: Naishmarie Lucas

customer_reviews.title: There was some friendly fire and we lost two beautiful luna moths in that battle
customer_reviews.text: We moved into the white mountains and found ourselves in a war against bugs. We were losing, badly, and had given up all hope. Then, the cavalry arrived. We were hoping it would work, but never expected the level of domination this beast would provide. The difference was noticeable overnight. Hundreds of mosquito corpses lay on this tank. There was some friendly fire and we lost two beautiful luna moths in that battle, but their sacrifice was not in vain. This zapper, like any artillery, is not for the faint of heart. We can hear it zapping through closed windows and doors. But that means that it's working.
customer_reviews.author: JPinchette

customer_reviews.title: Its okay... The bride is spaced too far apart.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to rid my property of the mosquitos and flies. I leave near the horse farms of MD and the flying insects are crazy. I bought this in hopes that it would rid me of this problem, however the guide spacings I think is a little to far apart and it does not zap as many as it should. The UV light is also SUPER bright and annoying. I ended ups returning it and getting a black flag one with uses a different black light and has close grid that even kills the ants. I would go with a different brand and would try the Black Flag ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't quite work for mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: I've high hope with this product and I bought it mainly to catch mosquitos but the result was disappointed. It does catch and attract bugs but not very effective for small insects. I think the problem is the so called non-clogging grid. The gap between the grid is just too wide to catch any small mosquitos. I guess it depends on your use case but unfortunately doesn't work effectively for me.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: It works awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it is plug and play. It comes with a ring that makes it easy to hang. The light is soothing, and every time you hear a bug meet its maker, you get a little smile. I have not even used the mosquito attractant packet it came with, as they naturally fly into the light for their last time pretty consistently. We even started a drinking game...every time one bites the dust, we salute and take a drink! Beware: you will not be able to sustain the game too long before you pass out. At least you won't wake up with mosquito bites. Buy it. Buy two.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Arabian

customer_reviews.title: Better than most
customer_reviews.text: The Flowtron arrived promptly with no damage. I hung it from a branch at the corner of our patio. It was busy zapping a variety of flying insects all night. I live in Phoenix and we are ravaged by the daytime Tiger mosquitoes as well as the night time mosquitoes. This is completely ineffective against the daytime Tigers. It does lure the nighttime mosquitoes, and unfortunately every other flying harmless insect. Its a well known fact that mosquitoes are not attracted to the black light and the efficiency of this unit relies on the Octenol cartridge. When it depletes they are hugely expensive to replace. If anyone has located a less expensive cartridge or other source please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Bobber

customer_reviews.title: Not for us!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking item however the cord is literally only 6” long. We have an electrical outlet mounted on the trim of our patio and even when hanging the lamp right next to it the plug couldn’t reach the outlet. Pathetic to have to use a 6” extension cord.... so just Ended up sending back!
customer_reviews.author: JET

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, attracts and kills so many bugs!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little dubious that this would actually work, but thought I would give it a try. Turns out it is amazing! If I didn't see it for myself I wouldn't have believed it, it kills so many bugs! It is not the easiest thing to clean out, and I have to do it daily because it gets so many that it is full! So, wish it was a little easier to clean, but I wouldn't trade it for anything! We have had it a few weeks, so hopefully it keeps going!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just gotta clean it now.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, I bought it for the backyard and put it to the test last night. After only 6 hours it was jam packed with bugs. It is a great product, I just wish it was a little easier to clean. Having to completly dismantle the thing every day is going to get old. (A quick release on the top lid just like the bottom would be awesome) That being said, it still does the job. On the plus side, I have a bunch of bugs for fishing now. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Amazing how quickly our yard cleared out of mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because our old one died at the end of the year last year. Mosquitoes were heavy this spring, due to the rain, and I could only handle 15 min. max outside without being bit. The first 4 nights, each night, the unit filled with mosquitoes to the point it was necessary to empty. It has been a few weeks, and we are no longer plagued by them. We still empty daily. VERY pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura D. Field

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I hate mosquitos, I truly do.... with that said I seriously almost feel bad for the bugs... this lamp is seriously effective for me and that is without the bait. Can't imagine if I tried to attract even more with the bait. If u have mosquito issues get this. Update couple of weeks into using it... Ahhh my husband just concluded I will go to hell for this slaughter of innocent bugs. I really wish this was only for mosquitos but I think no more explanation needed. This works too good ... I use no bait just darkness that this light illuminates and attracts bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Insect killing machine!
customer_reviews.text: Insect attracting killing machine. This picture was taken fifteen minutes after plugging it in. Amazing, may need another as I have to go out and constantly shake it to drop the dead build up, WOW, didn't even put any bait in it, the light is enough... Hope it holds up considering the amount of killing it is doing.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Rieger

customer_reviews.title: They work well, I just wish they last longer like they used to...
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these for this season, replacing two older ones that finally died. One lasted five years, and the other lasted two years. I'm expecting the new one to last two years. we place one in the front yard and the other in the back, away from the doors. The good thing about these zappers is that they do a good job at zapping bugs, even without the skeeter bait. I always wrap the plug and socket connection (extension cord) with electric tape so water can't get in. They work well, I just wish they last longer like they used to...
customer_reviews.author: Art Dad

customer_reviews.title: One purchase you won't regret!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing sweeter then sitting on your deck while listening to the relaxing sound of skeeters getting obliterated... I've had this for a few years, put it on a dusk dawn sensor and let it go to work. Live near a swamp and lake and the mosquitos can get bad. Since setting this up we can enjoy our deck at night. Constantly cleaning off the hundreds if not thousands of insects/mosquitos off of it. Well worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Sil13

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love
customer_reviews.text: This simple device is responsible for keeping the blooming mosquito population down to a tolerable level in our backyard. During the summer we kept the unit on 24/7 which the mosquito population was drastically reduced and allowed us to sit out back in peace and allowed our animals some reprieve from the bites. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Petrarch

customer_reviews.title: This Bug Zapper Is Amazing
customer_reviews.text: In two days I've killed thousands of mosquitoes and other flying insects. Both the north and south sided of my property (160 ft each) are perpetually wet, our ground water table is quite high, so we have a real mosquito problem here. This bug zapper is constantly zapping them, I assume a lot of bug fall to the ground, still in the morning the zapper is blanketed in dead bugs. If like me, bugs love the way you taste, you REALLY need to get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: John J Bologra

customer_reviews.title: Works great in SoCal
customer_reviews.text: Update: I left it outside every night for a month and it reduced flies/bugs dramatically. I highly recommend it as great way to control insects. I bought the smaller plug in type and another small stand type and neither worked at all so they were returned. This one works great. You hear the zap even when you plug it in. I leave it on in the patio during the night and it just keeps zapping lol. We don't get too many bugs in SoCal but it still zap about twice an hour. It's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: MrSept

customer_reviews.title: Finally a Solution to Mosquitoes in your house
customer_reviews.text: We use this big bug zapper in our garage where the mosquitoes really congregate. We bought a second unit to hang outside our house to try to minimize the mosquitoes that are terrible this year. The bug zapper in the garage only lasted about 1 year despite a 2 year warranty. Getting service on the warranty requires sending the entire unit at your cost to Flowtron. I will update you on whether Flowtron actually honors the warranty. Calling customer service is a waste of time since no live person answers.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this the end of April and I'm finally getting it set up. I pulled it out of the box and lo... no bait. I'm so frustrated with this. If you decide to spend the money on this item from this company, be sure to expect no bait and check your box when it arrives. I have no recourse at this time but to go buy some bait. I'm really quite disgusted with this experience. I'm 74 yrs old and have arthritis so getting around is difficult, and now I have to go back out again. Ordered April 28th.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon R

customer_reviews.title: ZAP ZAP
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Plugged it in for the first time and instantly ZAP ZAP! I was a startled and thought I had electrocuted myself. But no, it just instantly killed bugs in the area. I love this thing. I bought a $14 pole from Wal Mart and hung it up by the creek at the back of my lawn. The video of the burning bug is actually pretty unusual, but I thought it was cool. This thing is great for parties. People want to congregate near the lamp to watch it work.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Bugs are zapped!
customer_reviews.text: This thing definitely attracts bugs. It actually works great! My only problem is the extremely short plug, Atleast make it long enough to reach the outlet. Other than that it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 years so far.  Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I guess this product is discontinued or no longer available. Too bad. I bought it 3 years ago, hung it just outside the covered area of my deck, ran it 24x7 in all weather from March to November each year, finally took it down today to clean it. Took 10 minutes to disassemble, clean and reassemble, put back up and it is still going strong. It does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: This one works.
customer_reviews.text: After returning several bug zappers we finally found a winner. If you're looking for a zapper that does a powerful job, this is it. Most of the other zappers we've purchased present a black light like glow that attracts giant moths that would never get stuck in the zapper. This zapper is a slight bit louder but casts a white glow that attracts the annoying small bugs we wanted rid of.
customer_reviews.author: MrsIAmErica

customer_reviews.title: It fell apart
customer_reviews.text: It was working great for the few weeks I had it just hanging there. I walk out one morning and the plastic outer cage is in the grass. Two screw tabs were broken off. Odd since there's nothing near it that it could hit against. According to the warranty information I have to ship the whole thing to Flowtron to get a replacement. Shipping at my expense. That's pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Atwood

customer_reviews.title: Kills mosquitoes!
customer_reviews.text: We have a swimming pool in our backyard and we tried everything to keep them at bay. My friend recommended this and it’s amazing! We hung ours on a shepherds hook near our back fence. We used an extension cord to plug it in the outlet we have there. You don’t hear it at all. All you hear is when the mosquitoes get zapped. It’s the coolest thing! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Yzaguirre

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This thing really works every night we have a cook out with all the bugs being sapped at first I didn't hear anything but give it a few hours and it will attract the critters and fry them. I clean mines by just sampling using my leave blower which blows all the insect parts into the lawn for ant to clean up. I love it was being eating alive by Mosquitos now I don't even see any mosquitos around. Just which I would of bought it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this light does a good job. We are now in what I call ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this light because of reviews. Definitely worth it. We live on a lake in FL and as everyone knows mosquitoes are everywhere here. That being said, this light does a good job. We are now in what I call rainy season, high humidity and daily rain showers, living on the lake mosquitoes are a given to the point you don't even want to go outside. Hung this light about 30 ft from my patio door and it has been a life saver it seems to attract many flying insects and kills them keeping them from coming into the house when opening the door. Also has made it pleasant to sit out and enjoy the space without being eaten alive.
customer_reviews.author: ROSE R.

customer_reviews.title: Kills flys DEAD
customer_reviews.text: They say it's for outdoor use only, well I use it in my 600 sq. ft. grandpa room and it works just great, I have a fly problem due to being in the back yard where the dogs do their thing and also neighbors dogs in their yards so we have flys and I hate flys, so I hung this thing up next to another light and put a tray under it to catch the dead insects and other than the zapping noise driving my 2 bigs dogs nuts, short drive, it works excellent. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald G. Blake

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!!!
customer_reviews.text: Stop looking at any other zapper and purchase this one! My Black Flag zapper started waving a white flag 2 minutes after I plugged this in. The flowtron give a nice satisfying jolt sound for small insects and huge gratifying jolt for bigger bugs. This thing is seriously a beast and if you’re on the fence let me tell you that you won’t be disappointed and this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This definitely works lol
customer_reviews.text: Iv had this about a year now and this sucker really works. I highly recommend it. Check out the vid I attached. Bugs get absolutely FRIED.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Great item kills bugs, mosquitos,etc.
customer_reviews.text: Now this is a bug killer. I've purchased several other brands, one from QVC that's waste of money. This is best one on market. I live in south west Florida, on coast,and I hooked this up,very easy, and in one night there were probably 200 to 300 dead bugs,flies,mosquito, gnsts,moths etc. I use the attraction pads,they work good. Easy to do just peel and stick pad on bottom and your good to go. This is a very effective device. If the sound of bugs getting zapped bothers you,then you would need mount it far enough away that you cannot hear it. Very good item,I love it
customer_reviews.author: Starman

customer_reviews.title: Broken. Waited too long before trying out Zapper
customer_reviews.text: My Flowtron BK-15D Electronic Insect... Delivered Jun 25, 2017 Did not work when I finally made time to hang it. Now it shows I'm past my window for returns. Hopefully no one else has had this problem. I would like to get Replacement if possible.
customer_reviews.author: mlmick1

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely kills bugs. That thing started working the instant we plugged it in. Problem is we caught too many and had to turn it off. We live by a river so it began attracting lots of different flying insects which started to clog it up which was pretty gross. But anyhow it was easy for the Mr to clean and it definitely works. Oh and you’ll need an extension cord
customer_reviews.author: Enlightened Light

customer_reviews.title: Great product-short cord!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and kills many flying critters! Definitely well worth the money. Don’t waste your $$ on the cheap plastic ones! My only issue is that the “cord” that is attached to this is barely 2”. I immediately bought an extension cord and I was in business. You WILL need an extension cord if you want to use this. Otherwise, a great product that has kept our back porch free from bothersome flying pests!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for 1 day!
customer_reviews.text: I got this after reading the reviews. My Stinger bug zapper has seen better days, and after a long life it has zapped its last bug. The Flowtron worked great for 1 day..zapping everything sight. I gently blew any leftover bugs out of it (as directed) and hoped this would be the beginning of a beautiful relationship. However, it hasn't zapped since. Are you to tell me blowing bugs out it has disabled it forever? What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: Terence Egan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! I can work in my garage at night again.
customer_reviews.text: This thing kills bugs so fast! I put the light on tonight for the first time and let it run for 30 mins and come back to find hundreds of little white flies dead under it!!! I was never able to do work in my garage at night until now, thank you so much Flowtron for the amazing product, I feel like I can do work again in peace:)
customer_reviews.author: Accord

customer_reviews.title: 1 year review: it works!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. We’re over a year in now and I can say it does work well. Run 24hrs a day and now it’s time to replace the bulb. Easy clean up- I just use my leaf blower when I’m working on the yard (make sure your upwind 👍)
customer_reviews.author: Megan O'Keeffe

customer_reviews.title: Totally works.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy with this bug zapper. I couldn’t even sit on my back patio a week ago because of the mosquitos. I’m sitting here right now enjoying a beer. Still got 1 or 2 bites ( literally in 30 mins) but that’s a huge improvement. I Got a 1/2 acre model. It is really well made. It’s placed about 20 feet away from the patio. It’s hung on a plant stand with a 10’ cord going to a timer. The timer is on from 4-9 pm and 5-9 am. I also got spartan mosquito baits on the property. I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: singsling

customer_reviews.title: Attracts and kills bugs, not sure if attracts more than kills though...
customer_reviews.text: I only give it 5 stars because this is a good product compared to some others I've seen, NOT because it works...because, it doesn't. I am starting to thing this bug light concept is flawed. I don't notice a difference in mosquitoes around the shop since putting it between the shop and the hevily woodded pond (where most of our mosquitoes come from.) I think maybe it attracts even more than it kills, leaving the same amount buzzing around as before.
customer_reviews.author: Photostefanie

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I was literally unable to walk outside without coming back in with welts all over me from all the mosquitoes in my yard this summer. It has been about four days since I’ve started using the zapper and I’m able to go outside after dark again without fear of getting bitten. This is a must for anyone with mosquito issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bibliophile 76

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a nice unit and is working well so far. I bought this to replace a Hoont which was not a good product as bulbs just would not last very long. The only thing I dislike about this unit is the extremely short cord. Would have been nice if it were at least a foot long. So far so good, and if I have problems with it will change my review.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done!
customer_reviews.text: What I like about the electronic insect: 1. Easy to use (plug it in). 2. It's durable 3. It does what it supposes too. 4. It's nice and bright. What I don't like(s) 1. It can be noisy/loud when zapping the bugs. 2. The plug in cord is extremely short. 3. You might have to buy an extension cord. 4. Dead bugs( flies, insects, mosquitoes can draw a lot of ants). Don't put to close to your house.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bug Zapper!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my boyfriend and he loves it. Provides great entertainment on those hot summer nights on the porch! Works well but does leave a little bit of a mess underneath. We opted to use a shepherd's hook just next to the porch so the mess goes on the ground. It does need a three prong plug in if using an extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie S. Lively

customer_reviews.title: KILL those MOSQUITTOS!
customer_reviews.text: Love this zapper! Every day I am cleaning it due to the number of mosquitos/bugs it collects every night! Pretty amazing! I have never cleaned a bug zapper so much, well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the mosquito issue most people are having this year. While I can’t tell that it captured any mosquitos it sure did attract quite a few moths. I was surprised to see as many moths as we did in this trap. While a lot of insects fall to the ground after being zapped, many are also trapped inside. I guess as more insects get trapped we eventually have to throw this zapper away. I sure don’t want to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: JuneBug1783

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, terminating most insects,did not work on mosquitos.
customer_reviews.text: This is rather a powerful device however, according to County Rep is useless for mosquitos. I only bought this device for mosquitos. After few nights I keep hearing loud noises which were clear indication of other bigger size insects being terminated. This was between me and mosquitos not other insects and I lost.. I really do not think this device worked on our mosquitos ( Asian Tiger). I heard we do have different types of mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: moozikall

customer_reviews.title: not bad at all!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok . . . so it really isn't maintenance free, you do have to clean it. I was afraid this was going to be too noisy for our neighbors . . . only when it gets a huge moth or something does it sound like the current running through Frankenstein's monster. It works great on the mosquito issue, and I'm just happy to report it isn't as loud as we were afraid it was going to be. I don't envy my husband when it's time to clean it out. ewww.
customer_reviews.author: colo_chic

customer_reviews.title: Gnarly bug zapper. Made in America!
customer_reviews.text: Made in America from the info I found online. This thing works great. It zaps all night long. Does what its supposed to do. Definitely knocked down the level of mosquitoes in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Felterstuff

product_meta.title: Flowtron BK-15D Electronic Insect Killer, 1/2 Acre Coverage
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Size:1/2 acre coverage| Style:FlowtronFlowtronÆ electronic insect killer eliminates thousands of insect pests daily. Improves the health and quality of life by reducing the spread of infectious diseases and decreasing the annoyance level caused by flying insect pests. 2-year limited warranty. Dimensions L x W x H (in.): 8 1/2 x 8 1/2 x 13 1/2, Power Source: Electric, Compatible With: Octenol cartridges, UL Listed: Yes, Coverage: 1/2 acre, Indoor/Outdoor Use: Outdoor, Product Type: Bug zapper, Assembly Required: No, Material Type: Polycarbonate, Removal Of: Flying insect. Outdoor electronic insect control without the use of propane gas.

AMAZON.COM
Flowtron's lantern-style insect killer uses nontoxic ultraviolet light to eliminate mosquitoes, biting flies, and other insects over a 1/2-acre area. The insect killer is cleaner and safer than its chemical counterparts, and its patented nonclogging killing grid eliminates the grid clogging that can short-circuit the unit or cause flare-ups of insect remains. The insect killer features high-impact construction and a protective outer enclosure to prevent children, pets, birds, or wildlife from contacting the charged grid.
feature_bullets: Advanced electronic insect control; non clogging killing grid; 1/2-acre killing radius, requires plug.
Recommended not to be used within 25-feet of area intended for human activity, should not be attached to house or deck or other structures
Instantaneous operation, continuous and uninterrupted service, Uses a 15-watt bulb. The cord is 9” in length
For best results replace the cartridge every 30 days, Please refer User manual for troubleshooting and its corrections
Recommended for areas up to 1/2 acre - Outdoor Use Only
Avoids the continuing expense and inconvenience of chemical insecticides

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars13,152 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
